name: Fugue "Solitude b/w Traffic" 7" Single
description: MMR024 / AVO 001 Fugue's debut 7" single. Two tracks, 8 minutes. limited to 500 copies on maroon vinyl split release with Avacado Records.

name: Tobias Fünke "Read More" Cassette
description: This is the debut tape from Tobias Fünke. "Read More" has 7 tracks of reference filled twinkly emo jams for you and your special someone to sing along to in the car. Tapes are professionally duplicated, packaged in card stock o-card. Digital download included. Limited to 100 cassettes, white shells with black imprinting. Tracklist: 1. I'm Afraid I Just Blue Myself 2. 18 and Balding 3. I've Made a Huge Mistake 4. Bike Ride 5. Everything I Own Fits in my Prius 6. High Times 7. Fuck an Astronomy I'm Not Starry for Anything listen below:

name: Bedhed / Merry Christmas "Split" CS
description:
repress coming soon?

BEDHED and MERRY CHRISTMAS come together on cassette for the first time. BEDHED is a one man emo band from Los Angeles, CA and MERRY CHRISTMAS is a 'rough around the edges' indie rock quartet from Torrance, CA. 4 tracks from BEDHED, 5 tracks from MERRY CHRISTMAS. Limited to 100 pro printed and duplicated white cassettes.

Ships 3/29/13

name: Colossal Rex "Every Place is Sacred" 12" EP
description: These 5 songs, roughly 20 minutes of material, were recorded earlier this summer, and have taken physical form as a limited single sided 12" EP with a screen printed b-side, on coke bottle clear vinyl. Release date: 10/9/2012 Also available on iTunes

name: the Littlest Viking "S/T" 12" LP
description: The long-awaited second full-length from Los Angeles, CA's the Littlest Viking. Physical copies packaged in 2-layer screenprinted, custom die-cut sleeves w/ a semi-transparent vellum insert. Digital download included. Recorded by Jay Pellici at Tiny Telephones Studios and David Benitez at C+C Music Factory. Mastered by Jack Shirley at the Atomic Garden. also available on iTunes

name: Single Series Vol. 1 Box Set
description:
This limited edition hand screened boxset houses 3 7" singles by Tiny Lungs, Wild Pack of Canaries, and Brown and Blue. Each 7" single is pressed on coke-bottle clear vinyl, exclusive to this box set. All three records are wrapped in a graph paper wrap-around featuring extensive liner notes and pressing information pertaining to this first volume of singles. Also included is a free 45 adapter to make sure you can play the new singles on any turntable. The boxes were originally sold at the 2 in-store record release events we held in January 2012 at Fingerprints Music in Long Beach, CA and Origami Vinyl in Los Angeles, CA. The remaining boxes are now available for order. WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
  • Resealable, hand screen-printed 7" box
  • One copy of Tiny Lungs - "the Devil Who Painted the Wagon Red" b/w "Made Up War Stories" on coke-bottle clear vinyl
  • One copy of Wild Pack of Canaries - "Rain Brain" b/w "In Case of Hornets" on coke-bottle clear vinyl
  • One copy of Brown and Blue - "You Only Wanted Strength" b/w "Dirty Feed" on coke-bottle clear vinyl
  • Graph paper wrap-around with extensive/expanded liner notes
  • Free 45 adapter!

name: the Littlest Viking "Labor & Lust" 12" LP
description: Out now is the vinyl version of The Littlest Viking’s “Labor & Lust”. These Southern California shredders offer 10 songs of full of rich tones, technical rhythms, and the accessibility of the best pop songs. The 12″ LP will be available on opaque orange /50 and clear slime green /250. Click on the colors below for an image of the colored vinyl: ORANGE GREEN

name: Jason Clackley "to the Few and Far Between" 12" LP
description:
Previously split released on CD by Young Summer and Great Plains Records. Seattle’s Jason Clackley offers 9 tracks spanning from hard hitting soulful anthems to honest stripped down acoustic songs. The vinyl version includes a bonus vinyl only track and is offered on 3 color variations.

 Opaque pink /50 (sold out), coke bottle clear /100 and black /150.

name: Koalacaust / Big Kids Split 7"
description:
This split 7" is on yellow vinyl, features 3 layer hand screened artwork and is limited to 330 copies. This 7" includes a digital download code to get digital versions of the songs. 

2 songs from SF's Koalacaust, 1 song from Oakland's Bid Kids. Each side of the record is a little over 5 minutes long.

Art by Danny Nogueiras

name: Koalacaust "Smiles Shine Like Broken Glass" 7" EP
description: 3 new songs from San Francisco, CA's Koalacaust. Hifi recordings from Jack over at Atomic Garden studios. This new EP showcases Koalacaust with electric guitars and fun, energetic songs. A digital download card is included with this release that will allow for downloads of mp3 versions of the songs on this 7". the track Mirrors can be heard here on the bands myspace 4 color options. translucent pink (magenta/fuchsia/whatever) /40 SOLD OUT clear /50 translucent purple /100 black /150 limited to 350

name: Brown and Blue "You Only Wanted Strength b/w Dirty Feed"
description: New 7" single from Brown and Blue.

name: Wild Pack of Canaries "The Coroner Can Wait" CD
description:
Wild Pack of Canaries "The Coroner Can Wait" CD
Wild Pack makes the kind of music fit for the attentive ear, packing in layers of horns, chirping birds, mathy time signatures and oscillating reverb into surprising song progressions that work on a weird, cosmic level. De Anda’s vocals have a distinct honesty that makes you want to believe yes, these are real musicians making real music because they love it and they want to reward anyone else courteous enough to listen.
http://pejorativedysfunction.tumblr.com
Professionally duplicated and packaged in matte finished gatefold digipack CD sleeves. First couple hundred orders get a full color 11"x17" poster.

name: Tiny Lungs "the Devil Who Painted the Wagon Red b/w Made Up War Stories"
description: New 7" single from Tiny Lungs.

name: Wild Pack of Canaries "Rain Brain b/w In Case of Hornets"

name: Lazy Mary "Crazy Hairy" 7" EP
description:
There’s noise, there’s shrieking, there’s dirty, crunchy guitars, there’s the sound of lo-fi sub-pop poking it‘s head through a time machine into a 2010 bedroom. from Richard Ruston at thegirlsare.com
For fans of Slant 6, the Frumpies, Bikini Kill, the Stooges and Black Sabbath. 5 songs from Long Beach's lady duo Lazy Mary. Heavy and slow. Fast and raw. limited to 100 clear/black swirl, 200 black. Lazy Mary on Myspace

Recorded with Jack Shirley at the Atomic Garden. 
Big Kids jammed this one out before heading to Europe. 
It's amazing!

name: French Quarter "Live at the Sandlot" DVD-R
description:
Recorded live in Long Beach, CA, this 30 minute DVD-R features a set of 9 songs from Arizona's French Quarter. The set was recorded back on Valentine's day 2010 and after sitting on the footage and high quality audio recordings for a few months, we got in touch with Stephen and then the DVD-R was born. 

These DVD-R's have a 2 layer hand screened illustration on the discs and come with digital audio of the songs featured on the DVD. These files can be accessed by inserting the DVD-R into your computer.

name: Tiny Lungs "the Land of Gracious Living" Digital Single
description: Tiny Lungs recently visited Alex Estrada at the Earth Capitol to record the title track, “Land of Gracious Living”, from this single along with another track, “Rust Games”, to be used on a forthcoming compilation. “Catherine at the Movies” was self-recorded by Justin Conway at a different time. ### THIS ITEM IS A DIGITAL DOWNLOAD ONLY ### ### AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE/DOWNLOAD HERE ###

name: "Friends and Family" a Hunger Relief Benefit
description: ### THIS ITEM IS A DIGITAL DOWNLOAD ONLY ### ### AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE/DOWNLOAD HERE ### We wanted to get all of the bands that make up the Mountain Man family as well as some of our friends bands together to do something charitable. We decided to partner with Feeding America, the nation's leading domestic hunger-relief charity. Our hope is that our record label, and our friends bands, can help inspire our fans to help out the millions of children and adults that go hungry on a daily basis. All the bands on this compilation have graciously donated their time, effort, and most importantly, these songs to our cause. With a minimum donation of $5 you will recieve a high quality digital download of the 'Friends & Family' compilation. 100% of the profits will be donated to Feeding America.

name: Roman Candles "Riley Versus Jason in the Battle of Gracious Living" 12" LP
description: Brand new record from ROMAN CANDLES on Plan-It-X!

name: Erica Freas "Belly" 12" LP
description: from Rumbletowne Records After much ado: the fierce debut of Erica Freas' SOLO SHIT!!??!?!??!?! ... well ... "debut" if you don't count the countless cdrs over the past years. Trace the root of some of your fav RVIVR songs... or toss that idea from your aching head and listen deep to this beautiful music with fresh fucking ears. Witchy. What?!?!

name: RVIVR "the Beauty Between" 12" LP
description: from Rumbletowne Records Yoohoo! Can we please explain how hard we worked on this record?! I will copy in this text and it will not even come close to touching the hundreds and hundres (dare i say millions) of hours and tears and takes and thoughts and rewrites and inventions and snacks and walks to the Puge and... and... and... We are very very excited to unleash this BEAST!!!!!! One year smooshed and condensed into 42 minutes of sheer roller coaster excitement! Recorded by the Joester (Left Field Studios) at PUNKALL in Olympia, WA USA from July to December 2012 Mixed by the Joester and Mattie Canino also at PUNKALL in December 2012 Mastered by Carl Saff in January 2013 Played by Kevin Rainsberry (drums, sizzle) Mattie Canino (guitars, voice) Erica Freas (guitar, voice) Joey Seward (bass, organ) Jordan (baritone saxophone, tenor saxo) Jeff Doyle (snare drum) Dogjaw (voices) Bex Berryhill (voice)

name: RVIVR "S/T" 12" LP (Rumbletowne)
description:
Recorded by the Magnificent Phil Douglas of Huntington Station, Long Island, New York in two weeks (which were too short) in February 2010 at Punkall in Olympia, WA.
12 damn good tracks of the Pop Punk genre, but, what is this REALLY?
Ahem... Letter-pressed covers on discarded LP jackets flipped inside out. Spared no amount of extra effort.

The Knife Man sessions have yielded Andrew Jackson Jihad's most cohesive and driving album yet.

Algernon Cadwallader
"Some Kind of Cadwallader" LP (HGR003) 
The debut album by your truly. 38 minutes of your life that you will never get back.

name: "Parrot Flies" (Hot Green Records)
description: Top 10 of 2011, easy. The explosive joy, kaleidoscopic melodies and desperate energy that are the musical hallmark of Philadelphia-based contemporary emo superheroes Algernon Cadwallader tethers the trio's magical sophomore set Parrot Flies to a familiar musical center. The evergreen nature of these core components make for reliable building blocks; while many acts cut figurative corners and compose crap with figurative straw or sticks, Algernon Cadwallader's shit is constructed with brick, built to last. That the core components of the band's sound were first forged by superlative second-wave emo standard-bearers Cap'n Jazz doesn't matter. In fact, that the band is DIY from end-to-end (from the Facebook page: "Pete makes the t-shirt designs. We print all the shirts in our warehouse. Joe records and mixes all the music in his studio. We book our own tours. Tank does his own stand up comedy. Peter, Craig, and friends put out our records.") -- while interesting -- isn't even relevant, except to mass media pubs that still find it remarkable that bands and scenes can take care of themselves. No, what is paramount is the songs, and Parrot Flies' 11 songs represent an embarrassment of aural riches. from http://jbreitling.blogspot.com/

name: Hop Along "Gets Disowned" LP (Hot Green)
description:
Hop Along
"Get Disowned" LP (HGR004) 
Debut full length as a full band. What if "Freshman Year" went to the beach with "Wretches" and melted into one LP. Recorded by Joe Reinhart. Comes with download code.

name: the Exquisites "S/T" 12" LP (Asian Man)
description: Soulful punk music from Seattle, WA. The Exquisites' album is both intense and introspective at the same time, with driving drums and walls of guitars backing Jason Clackley's powerful croon. Plus, you gotta love that artwork!

name: Joyce Manor "Of All Things I Will Soon Grow Tired" 12" LP (Asian Man)
description:
Second? press on clear vinyl!
Joyce Manor's 2nd full length emerged after weeks in a dimly lit, hazy recording session with producer Jack Shirley. The few surviving witnesses reported having heard extended jam sessions, which purportedly included a savage 16-minute medley of "Smothered in Hugs" and "There Is a Light That Never Goes Out" among other hellish dirges. When a haggard courier arrived months later at Asian Man's doorstep, handing us the master copy of the record with his last breath, what was discovered were nine gems of dulcet guitar pop and cathartic punk. First pressing of vinyl includes 500 blue, 500 white, and 500 black records. Track Listing: 1.These Kinds of Ice Skates 2.Comfortable Clothes 3.See How Tame I Can Be 4.Drainage 5.Video Killed The Radio Star 6.If I Needed You There 7.Bride of Usher 8.Violent Inside 9.I'm Always Tired
From Asian Man Records

name: Summer Vacation "Condition" (Recess Records)
description:
Local faves, Summer Vacation made a great record! I don't think they've been playing together long enough for their chemistry to be as spot on as it is. It gets me off thinking that they might be obsessed with space camp. Regardless, the future looks brighter than shit! Shit's bright! No gimmicks, no "playing house", skinny jean cool fella bullshit here. Their influences can be anything. I know they dig the Blue Album but they seem influenced by their own environment more than anything else. I salute it! Includes a free download of the whole album, limited to 500 blue colored vinyl, and sports ultra ULTRA suave artwork by Penelope Gazin! Why are you just sitting there?!?
from Recess Records

name: Dreamdecay "Fern" 12" (Great Plains / Nuestra Laguna)
description:
Seattle’s noise troubadours - a heavy hand and an eerie wail. 5 tracks - one sided 12”. Split release between Great Plains and Nuestra Lengua. http://www.soundcloud.com/dreamdecay http://dreamdecay.blogspot.com/ http://www.mediafire.com/?cm0040aetq0hcx9
"Challenging noise from where else but the hub of punk ingenuity, Washington state. Dreamdecay are a Seattle born toast to a doggedly unwavering, touch-warmer-than-death strain of noise rock. Their five track record 'Fern' floats into being with a blizzard of screaming guitars - a clamorous instrumental race to the beginning of the song that sounds like Earth trying to play a 'Bloody Valentine jam and freaking out under the frustration. 'The Dire and Ever Circling Wolves' with another guitar and a Scratch Acid injection. On first hearing the vocals I thought they pulled directly from the commanding cries of Michael Gira, yet there's something almost heraldic about these utterances, that kind of touch upon desert splutters and doomy coughs. Praise to the lead singer though, whose post-punk lump in the throat does well to arc over the top of the candle-lit tumult swarming beneath him. I think the intention with this record is to initially trip up it's listeners, with huge blocks of impassable sawing, screeching fuzz and buried beneath the sand vocals. 'Fern' throws all of it's initial weight behind the idea of testing you as a listener, but comes down hard with lashings of North Western musical heritage to wash away the drone fan's take on rock that you've been struggling to swallow. Tracks II & III do much of what the opening number did, but bake it into four and two minute drone odes to Confusion Is Sex. 'Fern' treads heavily, most often at a lumbering pace, yet ignores the confines of already written Sludge metal and takes convention to task with the bestial assault of the Melvins and a charged post-punk overlay. The now noticeable slacker vocals push a little harder into the skirmish. Things progress to an almost funereal state by the time the ending track appears, not before track 'IV' gets to flex it's Jesus Lizard without the metal chops with a quickly spun math-y opening that ends up working as the entire spine of the track, holding up a canopy of drawn-out early Swans electricity. The sheer love for butchering about with feedback and laying off any metallic precision keeps this record constitutionally punk in some sense, but the common feel of 'Fern' doesn't lend itself to anything other than a 'noise' tag. There are passages of ear-splitting doom, vague dream sequences of gazey proportions and even a well submerged predisposition towards the sooty grunge of Mudhoney. Get listenin’” - Pagan Punx

name: Key Losers "California Lite" 12" LP (P.W. Elverum & Sun)
description:
Key Losers is a band based in Portland, Oregon, whose songwriter, singer, guitarist, and only constant member is Katy Davidson (Lloyd & Michael, Cynthia Nelson Band, YACHT) . Davidson once led the band Dear Nora, which disbanded in 2008. "California Lite" is Key Losers’ first official full-length album, though Key Losers did release a 9-song “mini-album” called Adjust on States Rights Records in early 2010. Key Losers is a band that may be characterized by its concept-driven lyrics and melody-driven music.

"California Lite" was engineered by Phil Elverum (Mount Eerie) in Anacortes, Washington, during late 2010, due out on May 24th via Elverum's P.W. Elverum and Sun. It was recorded by Katy and friends referred to as “Key Losers Black Crow Session Band” featuring Karl Blau (K Records), Greg Campanile (Total Noise), Andrew Dorsett (LAKE / K Records), Tom Filardo (Total Noise), Nick Krgovich (No Kids / Tomlab Records) and Eli Moore (LAKE / K Records).

name: Ridgemont "Colder Days" LP (Mindless/Kiss of Death)
description:
In less than 2 short years, Allston, Massachusetts' Ridgemont have managed to release a demo, the "Documented Failures" EP, a special tour edition cassette and record a full-length. It's no small coincidence that the energy the four members put into the band happens to bleed through musically into their especially energetic brand of melodic punk. Inspired by early Propaghandi, Dillinger Four, Latterman and showing traces of a love for Thin Lizzy, Ridgemont spends their time humbly playing the music they hold dear to their hearts. With only a small amount of touring under their belts so far, the band expects to spend a whole lot more time out on the road once their first full-length is released. The album boasts a whopping 14 songs of rapidfire vocals, noodling guitars and sweaty sing-alongs.
Out of 500, hand screen printed covers.

name: Flechette "Flechette" LP (Sound Era)
description:
Flechette from RVA! It's angular!
The debut album by Richmond, Virginia's golden boys, Flechette. Imagine Drive Like Jehu and Fugazi having a few drinks and making a few irresponsible decisions, and wa-la! This 7 track LP was recorded by Tim Gault at Double 00 studio, and was pressed at 45 RPM for maximum quality. 203 on white, 308 on black.
From Sound Era

name: "Condensed Nothing" (Holy Page)
description: A new cassette from Holy Page graced with the music of the limitless talent Stephen Steinbrink! This cassette is just under 30 minutes and will really blow your mind! Listen here http://stephensteinbrink.bandcamp.com/album/condensed-nothing

name: Stephen Steinbrink "Rennet" CS
description:
"Rennet" on Cassette 10 Songs!
“Rennet” is Stephen Steinbrink’s statement of apolitcal activism. “Rennet” is all parts of speech. “Rennet” is a enzyme found in a cow’s stomach. Moral Omnivoration. Emphatic atrophy. Like a sun-bleached can of cola lying idle for years in the desert. Or, upon hearing gunfire, being scared, and trying to decide whether or not to call the Police. "Rennet" is a convoluted expression of “Arizona Goddam”. Technically his 14th album of songs (following the two full length LP’s released in 2010, French Quarter’s “It’s Not Just Kissing” and eponymous “Yellow Canary Jumpsuit”) sees a prolific artist in transition. Partially produced and heavily influenced by Sonoran sound artist Glochids, these songs run the proverbial gamut, from Steinbrink’s expected sparse guitar based meditations to “new” hook-based dance pop, utilizing traditional Indonesian Gamelan gongs, and heavy use of Glochid's and Steinbrink’s field recordings.
from Gilgongo Records
Stephen Steinbrink / French Quarter

name: So Adult "Rookie" CS
description:
the 3rd pressing of So Adult's "Rookie" EP.
4 songs from these Bellingham, WA 90's indie prodigies.

name: Jason Clackley "and the Exquisites" CS (Great Plains)
description: Another concise masterpiece from the soulful, dedicated brain of our great northern bard, Jason Clackley. Relentless and loud, melodic and plaintive - from full-band electric to just Jason pounding the keys of his piano (!) and wailing at the top of his lungs. Artwork by Gavin Tiemeyer, who happens to be the legs pumping the piston kick drum that keep this tape rolling. Four bucks and one for shipping. Tapes and screen-printing by our good friends at In the Pocket Tapes.

4. My Personal Experience 
5. Oceanic 
6. Icy Revelations From The Red Planet 
7. New York And The Picturebook To Remember Her By

description:
Here's something awesome.
It's an 18"x24" newsprint poster with an illustration of everyone from every band we released something by in our first year as a label. 
The illustration is by Dave Van Patten. 

By default we will be shipping these folded, if you want it shipped in a tube you can select that option from the dropdown menu.
